alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 22 at 7:49PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Ulster and southwestern Greene Counties through 830 PM EDT... At 749 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Meredith to near Willowemoc to Cuddebackville. Movement was north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Ellenville, Wallkill, Prattsville, Woodland Valley Campground, Kerhonkson, Napanoch, Wawarsing, Crawford, Shandaken, Denning, Cherrytown, Palentown, Dwaarkill, Oliverea, Liebhardt, Fantinekill, Awosting, Cragsmoor, Mombaccus and Honk Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Ulster; Western Greene; Western Ulster
